summary: Build an HRMS portal including employee data management, performance management, onboarding, and related HR modules.

existing_features.title: Add authentication and role-based access control using Internet Identity with at least two roles: Admin/HR and Employee. Admin/HR can create/update all employee records and configure onboarding/performance items; Employees can view their own profile and complete assigned onboarding tasks and performance actions.

Implement the Employee Data module with persistent storage and CRUD: employee profiles (name, email, department/team, job title, manager, start date, employment status), plus a searchable employee directory and an employee detail page.

Implement the Onboarding module with onboarding plans, task assignment, and completion tracking. Support creating onboarding templates (set of tasks), assigning a plan to a new hire, tracking task status (Not started/In progress/Done), due dates, and optional notes/links per task.

Implement the Performance module with goals and performance reviews: allow creating goals for an employee (title, description, start/end dates, status, progress), and a review cycle feature where Admin/HR can create a review cycle and request employee self-review input plus manager/HR evaluation notes.

Create an HRMS navigation structure and core screens in the React app: Dashboard, Employees (Directory + Profile), Onboarding (Admin/HR templates + assignments, Employee tasks), Performance (Goals + Reviews). Use React Query for data fetching/caching and show loading/empty/error states for all views.
Define a coherent, non-blue/purple visual theme for the HRMS portal (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and apply it consistently across all screens using Tailwind + shadcn components.
Generate and include required static images in the frontend at `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and render them in the app UI (e.g., app header/login and dashboard).
